column1: But these contractors tried to fight back. They claimed @HHSGov should delay making changes until after the pandemic. This made no sense to @RepKarenBass and me especially given the risks COVID poses to many patients in organ failure. (3/5)  https://t.co/EhhycrJCXc

The federal government has awarded billions of taxpayer dollars to companies working to tackle COVID-19. Many of these taxpayer-funded contracts have details that have been kept secret so @SenWarren and I are calling on the Administration to release them. https://t.co/n4ed4h8Z5O

As COVID cases surge in Orange County and across our state I’m thinking about the frontline healthcare workers who are fighting this pandemic. Our office has been collecting thank you notes for essential workers in our hospitals. Learn more and submit ⬇️ https://t.co/pb8wUwUUvc

Yet the Fed used COVID relief funding to purchase $1.3 billion of Exchange-Traded Funds (ETFs). ETFs are baskets of stocks similar to mutual funds and they contain billions of Wall Street's debt. (3/5)  https://t.co/q2vORsOE8A

The Fed explicitly stated that COVID relief funds would not help “insured depository institutions”—aka banks. That makes sense since many of those banks have had record profits during the coronavirus pandemic. And we just bailed them out in 2008-2009. (2/5) https://t.co/VoUiR2wNsS

In March Congress gave billions in COVID relief to the @federalreserve to help struggling businesses. The Fed pledged these taxpayer dollars would *not* bail out Wall Street banks. They went back on their word—to the tune of 2 billion dollars. So I'm calling them out. (THREAD)

No American regardless of their political views is helped by having a disruptive transition of power. We are in the middle of a pandemic and a recession— we need stable leadership and an orderly transition to fight COVID-19 and get our economy back on a path to recovery.

It’s imperative that the officials running the COVID vaccine development program are working in the public’s interest not their own. Yet the Administration’s top scientist won’t divest the millions he has in pharma companies.   @SenWarren and I are demanding an investigation ⬇️ https://t.co/TTrHIjE3YH

My heart aches for the family of Gale Ballard who passed away last Friday after COVID-like symptoms. She worked for @ATT for two decades but was denied the same work-from-home options as many of her colleagues.  https://t.co/SmguwXNMtd

Since March 150 Orange County workers have been urging @ATT to let them work from home. The company has yet to oblige—or even create a regular on-site testing program—despite a COVID-19 outbreak that’s led to 35 cases and one death.  I’m demanding answers from the CEO directly. https://t.co/ZaDT0L58gR

The COVID-19 crisis is threatening both our physical and mental health. It’s more important than ever that we improve mental health care in our country and I have two bipartisan bills to do just that. https://t.co/CLCxUzPPGc
Well it should be. If @BetsyDeVosED isn’t working to keep students and teachers safe during the COVID-19 crisis what is she spending her time doing? https://t.co/nSUrpJBj00

Telehealth visits are essential for many Americans especially our seniors to stay safe from COVID-19. By ending fee waivers @UnitedHealthGrp and @AnthemInc are putting our communities at risk to boost profits. (1/2)  https://t.co/YSj0iCfWCD

The COVID-19 crisis has placed an incredible burden on working families leading to an increase in food insecurity in our communities. On Wednesday I volunteered to help prepare food boxes for Orange County families and I'll keep fighting in Congress for stronger relief. https://t.co/jJ5oylswht

Economic recovery hinges on two things: getting the virus under control and working families being back on their feet. With over half of COVID relief money going without oversight to businesses it’s clear these weren’t priorities of the Administration.  https://t.co/W0XFz9AULY

TODAY: I’m hosting a town hall conversation with @unitedwayoc’s @BecksHeyhoeOCUW on tackling Orange County’s homelessness and housing affordability crisis which has been made worse by the COVID-19 pandemic. Join us at 7 PM PT by visiting my Facebook page /RepKatiePorter. https://t.co/CrcSNj8egi

That's why I introduced legislation—the Support Working Families Act—to make it easier for parents to get relief if their kids can't go to school or childcare because of COVID-19.  More info 👇  https://t.co/H1yvAou2a2

In July @SenKamalaHarris and I wrote to the Administration demanding comprehensive guidance for schools on how to reopen safely. We never heard back. Meanwhile the White House was focused on pressuring @CDCgov to downplay the risks of COVID-19 to kids.  https://t.co/cebvXkxP8r

Today there are 7000000 cases of COVID-19 in the U.S. We don’t know how many of these Americans will be left with permanent damage to their lungs hearts and other organs—aka a pre-existing condition. But we’ve seen that this can happen to those with even mild symptoms. (5/7)

Frontline workers have made incredible sacrifices to keep our community safe during the COVID-19 crisis. Today our office is launching a new program for Orange County families to thank these heroes directly.  Learn more and submit a thank you note ⬇️  https://t.co/pb8wUwUUvc

We have lost at least 3 teachers to COVID-19 in recent weeks. Yet the Administration still won’t provide school districts with comprehensive guidelines based on science to keep educators kids and parents safe nor the resources needed to implement them. https://t.co/1JxyI0FL26

Today on my whiteboard: how the Administration's coronavirus response has failed our kids.  They negotiated billions in corporate relief yet they won't send much-needed help to our students which especially hurts those with disabilities.  Here's the math >> https://t.co/at8p48Uizt

Cost shouldn’t be a deterrent to seeking medical care especially during a pandemic and knowing who has COVID-19 is one of the best tools we have to stopping its spread.  By failing to implement free testing for all the Administration is making us less safe.

In March I asked @CDCDirector to use his existing legal authority to make COVID testing free for all. Congress then mandated free testing when we passed the CARES Act *five months* ago.  Yet Americans are still getting billed.  https://t.co/swqGz0FY9h

In the middle of a pandemic the President is publicly touting a treatment that has never been tested in animals or humans as a cure for COVID-19. My colleagues and I are demanding answers from @US_FDA which is supposed to protect Americans from dangerous medical treatments. https://t.co/L9UfDbt0By

My heart breaks for this Orange County family and for every American who has lost loved ones to COVID-19. Our country is failing our kids and we need the Administration to step up and provide our communities with the resources we need to save lives.  https://t.co/PxamxBfHdK

The Administration put Big Pharma executives at the helm of efforts to develop a COVID vaccine. But they’re not required to let the public know if they’d financially benefit from the vaccine that makes it into mass production. This deserves a full independent investigation. https://t.co/doVSLKAm6f

Families shouldn’t have to choose between taking care of their kids and making ends meet especially during a pandemic. That’s why I introduced legislation to provide relief to working parents whose kids can’t go to school because of the COVID-19 crisis.  https://t.co/ryGX2FxPde

Knowing who has COVID-19 is one of the best tools our community has to stopping its spread. That’s why I pressed @CDCDirector back in March to use the Administration’s authority under the law to make COVID testing free for all.  https://t.co/VC8dl9VjSX

In March I secured a commitment from @CDCDirector that COVID testing would be free. The president signed this promise into law but Americans are still being billed.  I’ll continue holding the Administration and insurance companies accountable until they follow the law. More ⬇️ https://t.co/rsMa6kbKUG

From infection rates to daily case counts there are a LOT of numbers out there that measure the spread of COVID-19. On Monday I’m hosting a town hall with @UCIrvine's @dwodarz to break down what these numbers actually mean for Orange County. Join us on Facebook Live at 2 PM PT! https://t.co/7Mckl6Uriw

.@GileadSciences wants to charge you between $2300 and $3100 for their experimental COVID treatment.  For reference: Production cost per vial: $1 Taxpayer funding for their research: $70500000 (as estimated by @Public_Citizen)  Big Pharma's greed will kill Americans. https://t.co/TKfiR6FOFq

The Senate wants to give corporations legal immunity if their workers get COVID-19. Translation: no consequences if a company doesn’t provide protective equipment or enforce physical distancing.   This is a green light for corporate abuse. RT if you agree: #NoCorporateImmunity

Remote patient monitoring devices allow patients with mild COVID-19 symptoms to be monitored at home. Yesterday I introduced bipartisan legislation to make it easier for healthcare workers to get their hands on these critical tools. Read more here⬇️  https://t.co/AqADAdcSER

Existing law grants relief to parents who have to stay home with kids because schools and other childcare facilities are closed due to COVID-19. Today I introduced legislation that would help families burdened by partial closures too. Read more ⬇️  https://t.co/AqADAdcSER

It’s not just Lockheed. @RaytheonTech and @generaldynamics have also seen their profits skyrocket in recent months. Yet all three companies are requesting taxpayer-funded coronavirus relief. (2/3)  https://t.co/WCu22w8RmR

TODAY: I’m hosting a town hall to update Orange County families on how I’m fighting to fix our healthcare system and hold healthcare companies accountable during the COVID-19 crisis. Join me today at 5 PM PT by visiting https://t.co/rzIQKQEwuG or dialing 855-962-1016.

The Trump Administration awarded $6.6 BILLION in taxpayer money to private companies for the development of a COVID-19 vaccine. My colleagues and I are asking @SecAzar how the Administration plans to make the vaccine affordable for all considering the public paid to develop it. https://t.co/qkB7IPqXnB

I asked the VP of @LockheedMartin why they’re asking for taxpayer-funded COVID-19 relief when they’ve made MORE money during this pandemic than during normal times. His response? Other companies are doing it.  Here’s my suggestion: use your extra profits to protect your workers. https://t.co/skNr7QVaVy

Kids are not immune from the coronavirus. The federal government must communicate with school districts on how to educate students safely this school year.  We need resources. We need testing. We need leadership.  https://t.co/wiqZqRukgc

I am furious. Maxx was a healthy eighth grader who swam competitively. This tragedy could have been avoided had the Trump Administration not been derelict in its duty to take COVID-19 seriously in January and work around the clock to keep families safe.  https://t.co/6I8pNZNKZV

This week from @LockheedMartin...  Monday: Tell the White House you need a bailout because of COVID-19  Tuesday: Announce profits are up and that you've made $3.5 billion so far this year  Wednesday: Fail to answer Congress' questions about why you should get taxpayer dollars ⬇️ https://t.co/HMowwAEHRm

Imagine we can prevent COVID-19 infection with an injection before a vaccine is widely available but private companies don't want to pay for research on it.  Stop imagining. It's real and @CongressmanRaja & I want the Administration to fund this research that could save lives. https://t.co/zIUmCh5S5y

Two months ago the House passed legislation to extend federal assistance beyond July for the millions who lost their jobs as a result of the COVID-19 crisis.  1.3 million more Americans filed for unemployment last week. They need the Senate to do its job. https://t.co/qyMbBwB5xi

The COVID-19 crisis is a stark reminder of our country's lack of investment in our kids. Affordable and quality childcare is especially important for gender equality (not to mention our economy!) and it can make life a smidge easier for single parents like me. 😉👩‍👧‍👦

Salma’s husband Payam had been waiting years for his visa application to be processed. I’m so glad our office was able to help secure a visa and reunite this family especially during the COVID-19 crisis.  Salma and Payam congratulations on your newborn. Enjoy every moment! https://t.co/xjZ7u3kVOD
@Phil_Mattingly Thank you! Come for the incisive questioning about a potential COVID-19 vaccine; stay for the quilt in the background made by my mom and Quilters Hall of Fame inductee Liz Porter.

As always seismologist and disaster communicator @DrLucyJones is imparting critical wisdom to Southern California families. We all should be employing her COVID-19 safety motto “don’t share your air” by keeping our masks on and staying six feet apart.  https://t.co/DNcUx1AozP

As COVID-19 cases surge @BetsyDeVosED is demanding schools reopen without doing the work to make it safe.  Refusing to communicate a plan is careless. Forcing schools to open before it’s safe is dangerous.  @SenKamalaHarris and I are calling this out ⬇️  https://t.co/wiqZqRcIRC

These contractors (known as Organ Procurement Organizations or OPOs) are urging @HHSgov to delay new oversight measures AND asking for more taxpayer dollars.  This makes no sense. COVID-19 is a major threat to patients in organ failure. OPOs must be held accountable. (2/3)

While getting help to struggling small businesses is critically important one of the problems we’re seeing with coronavirus relief programs is that big banks are making money administering this aid. Small businesses and working families need to come first. https://t.co/LCsbFwApvy

Let me clear: we shouldn't send kids teachers and staff back to school until it's safe. But we won't get there unless we have a plan to test for COVID-19 and stop its spread. And the federal government will likely have to provide support to make this happen.

Leonard Green looted hundreds of millions from the pensions of healthcare workers and hospitals in underserved communities. They put profits before patients. Now these hospitals are struggling to treat people and mitigate the spread of COVID-19.  https://t.co/agxgzMHFAP

Higher education is an investment in the futures of our young people and the future of our workforce. Now—not next month—is the time for us to think about what support our students need to safely head back to school this fall and that includes a robust plan for COVID testing. https://t.co/Sh90rvao7r

I am still hearing from Orange County families every day that they face barriers to getting tested for COVID-19.  Widespread testing is critical to our efforts to stop the spread of coronavirus. I’m joining @RepMikeLevin to get answers from @ochealth. https://t.co/2xmGGBUvo3

PPP is a 650000000000 taxpayer funded program that gives grants to companies who keep their workers on payroll during #COVID19. It needs to work. The money has to go to the people who need it. But @SBAgov has essentially no plans to review 99% of PPP loans. (2/4)

.@CoveredCA just announced they’re extending the special enrollment deadline due to COVID-19. Eligible Californians now have until July 31st to sign up for healthcare coverage. You can find info here:  https://t.co/0EHNL0JhtD

Healthcare providers are required by law to report how they spent taxpayer-funded coronavirus relief but @SecAzar is standing in their way.  Working families deserve to know how their tax dollars are being used. @BillPascrell and I are demanding answers. https://t.co/vK5m8DMv3M

.@tenethealth has been accused of grossly overcharging Medicare yet it's received nearly $1 billion in COVID relief funds and $91 million in new tax benefits.   Corporations shouldn't be able to scam Americans then pocket our tax dollars. (3/3) https://t.co/O2FVyqNhqc

In 2018 @primehealthserv paid $65 million to settle allegations that it overcharged Medicare. In 2020 the corporation received $600 million in taxpayer-funded COVID relief.   Meanwhile working Americans received a one-time $1200 payment. (2/3) https://t.co/LW3n1OsL9b

I say this as someone who has pushed for oversight of COVID relief from the start: this news is a big win for American taxpayers.  Now to get real accountability we need a commitment that this data be online searchable and regularly updated. And make the initial release soon. https://t.co/5xFSWjuUJq

I was recently billed for a COVID test I received in March and I've heard countless stories from other Americans being charged. Today I'm following up yet again with @CDCDirector about why testing still hasn't been made free for every American. https://t.co/uqPJSWG9io

I want to learn more about COVID-19 testing capacity in our district and to hear about your experiences with testing. I've created a short survey where you can share your story about being tested or trying to get a test in your area: https://t.co/EsewYTNJAG

76 days ago the Congressional Oversight Commission was created to monitor the $500B coronavirus bailout but it still doesn't have a chair. As I said at a hearing I led yesterday: "It has been too long already; we cannot afford to continue waiting." https://t.co/OVirWUeu8K

NOW: I am co-chairing a hearing about the need for robust real-time oversight on how we spend taxpayer dollars on coronavirus relief. We need transparency and accountability to make sure that money goes to help working families and not line the pockets of corporate executives. https://t.co/kix7mcEJLH

When @SenKamalaHarris appointed me to be California’s watchdog over big banks I saw how working families wouldn’t get help unless we held special interests accountable. Today we're calling on Congressional leaders to prioritize oversight of the coronavirus corporate bailout. https://t.co/jUYxiGE8Cg

This #APAHM we acknowledge the disturbing spike in anti-Asian racism tied to the #COVID_19 pandemic. Nobody should face harassment or violence due to their heritage—that’s why I worked with @RepGraceMeng on legislation to condemn bigotry and investigate hate crimes.

These are scary and confusing times. My office is regularly updating a COVID info tab on our website with answers to common questions. Please visit the site to learn about student loan payment deferral unemployment benefits health insurance and more. https://t.co/bDjKEgguhZ

I’ve pressed Mr. Dimon before on what he’s doing to make sure employees at his company can make ends meet. I’ll stay on this because I know that workers are the backbone of our capitalist economy which the coronavirus is attacking. https://t.co/ccwieDWAw2

The coronavirus is attacking our capitalist economy; the #PaycheckGuaranteeAct helps preserve it. It avoids expanding government by allowing our businesses to keep workers on payroll which will reduce administrative costs and allow government to focus on public health. https://t.co/YOa8b0HLDj

For over a year we haven't had a permanent Senate-confirmed Secretary at @DHSgov. This has hampered our coronavirus preparedness and response. I've introduced legislation that would restore public accountability for top administration officials. https://t.co/1fjbiDiqgy

I have been proud to advocate for the PAWS Act which helps domestic violence survivors with pets leave their abusers in coronavirus aid legislation. Now that we've strengthened this critical program we must fight to renew the Violence Against Women Act. #VAWA https://t.co/KGF8XltUog

Today is #ChildrensMentalHealthDay. I brought @chocchildrens Chief Psychologist Dr. Heather Huszti as my guest to the State of the Union this year to highlight why this issue is so important. As #Covid_19 highlights the flaws in our healthcare system we must stay on this. https://t.co/fZkLDb1HUM

Let me be clear: I will continue to speak truth to power and call out corporate abuse regardless of whether I serve on the Congressional Oversight Commission.  Read my full statement on oversight of coronavirus relief efforts ⬇️⬇️ https://t.co/klzSkI6OTf

Here are the facts:  1) President Trump has the authority to use the DPA to meet a number of critical needs—including #COVID19 tests.  2) Congress allocated $1B to the DPA fund for that exact reason.  3) 40000 Americans died before President Trump used the DPA to order tests.

8/8 I’m getting on the phone to make another batch of calls now. There is no substitute for hearing the voices of our neighbors. No briefing news stories or social media feed can convey the pain—and strength—of Americans in the face of COVID-19.

Irvine Company is offering a hardship exemption to residents who can’t pay rent because of #COVID_19.  This email was sent out after our office relayed concerns from UCI students and OC renters and we worked with IC to send clear communication that relief was available. ⬇️⬇️ https://t.co/VzrSjktfe9

As the first single mom of young kids to serve in the U.S. Congress the disproportionate burden of the coronavirus pandemic on women and single parents was something I thought about right away.  📺 Watch my exchange with @MichelMcQMartin on @AmanpourCoPBS ⬇️⬇️ https://t.co/MIL5WboCMw

Nobody chooses to get sick yet many Americans have to worry about long-term financial punishment due to unexpected medical costs. #COVID_19 brings into focus why this is wrong. I’m introducing a bill to protect patients’ credit from being dragged down by medical debt.

I just finished a telephone briefing with White House officials on the #covid_19 response. I’m bringing out #KatiePortersWhiteboard to share with everyone what I learned. Watch me LIVE >> https://t.co/tL27gV2sYp

While I was sounding the alarm on #Covid_19 President Trump was encouraging companies to *increase* exports of medical supplies—as recently as the beginning of March.   This and more in my new report on the Administration's catastrophic mismanagement ⬇️⬇️ https://t.co/8si6IYUzWM

Wellness Matrix Group told consumers their product was “FDA vetted and approved”—even  though the FDA hasn’t approved ANY at-home COVID test. @CongressmanRaja and I have launched an investigation but our work isn't done. I'm staying on the case and seeing this through. https://t.co/pDUkxYpGTy

BTW one of the reasons the already-too-high number of families in medical debt will skyrocket is because this Administration has failed to make COVID-19 *treatment* free for Americans who need it. Of course the President continues to lie about this too. https://t.co/hZoNxtN94C
My COVID-19 test came back negative which is a relief. I am still staying home because I have symptoms and need to recover; this means I will not be able to travel to Washington DC to vote.

Over the weekend I had a fever over 100.4 degrees. As instructed I continued to isolate in my bedroom and phoned my provider. I carefully followed all instructions to visit my doctor and received a test for COVID-19. I am waiting for results. (3/4)

Paid leave will keep communities safe as people feeling unwell can stay home. I’ve written about why it’s important that any subsequent legislation to address #COVID_19 mandates comprehensive paid leave for Americans working for large employers. (17/?) https://t.co/p5WlYnnVjo

I’ve studied families struggling to make ends meet; I know that a lot of Americans need help quick. As Congress continues to work on providing coronavirus relief I’ve pushed for every person to get $1000 a month to put workers before corporations. (16/?) https://t.co/X2qWaho9gW

We know that our seniors are facing additional challenges in dealing with this pandemic. I secured a provision in @FSCDems coronavirus relief legislation that would support service coordinators helping older adults. (15/?) https://t.co/5WD05TuRs4

Along with @RepMalinowski I’m protecting consumers by demanding answers about a new COVID-19 triage website. Big Tech shouldn’t be profiting off people’s personal data especially when Americans are busy staying safe during a pandemic. (9/?) https://t.co/OCdiwqA9Vr

Along with my colleagues @RepUnderwood and @Rosa_DeLauro I wrote a letter to call on the Trump Administration to use its existing authority to make #COVID_19 testing free for any American that needs it—regardless of insurance. (4/?) https://t.co/5FNgTbvYQA

One of my top responsibilities as a Congressmember is to keep #CA45 residents informed about the facts. That’s why I produced a FAQ on the coronavirus outbreak and have been updating it regularly since January. (3/?) https://t.co/bzFDuVnfS8

When Orange County had one of the first confirmed cases of coronavirus in the United States I immediately sent a letter to the CDC. At the time I was one of a few federal officials calling for us to prepare for this now-pandemic. (2/?) https://t.co/oPzBbpfHhN

I’ve taken #coronavirus seriously from Day 1. Today marks 8 weeks since I pushed the CDC to brief Congress on the threat posed by #COVID_19. Since then I’ve been working around the clock to address this crisis. Here’s some of what I’ve been up to: (THREAD)
To read more about my bill to help our older adults during the #CoronavirusPandemic visit my website here >> https://t.co/LM2DcxJMOU

The Defense Production Act allows the federal government to mobilize industry during a national security emergency. A provision I wrote included in @FSCDems #COVID_19 legislation would require all orders placed under the DPA to be made public.

These last few weeks have been hard on our community but in the midst of this difficult time I want to take a second to recognize some of the really important collaborative work coming out of Orange County on the front lines of the fight against #COVID_19. ⬇️⬇️

As a single working mom I have to juggle—I couldn’t do it without a childcare provider. As the #COVID_19 pandemic continues to take kids out of school and after this emergency has passed let’s take time to thank our nation’s #childcare providers who make the juggling possible.

I know the #Covid_19 news is overwhelming for many in our community so I wanted to explain @GavinNewsom's statewide shelter-in-place order. The summary: it's not as scary as it sounds. Read this thread to learn more.

I’m glad that party leadership is finally taking the idea of remote voting seriously after two Members tested positive for #Covid_19. I’ve been calling for this since last week—before these reports—because we need Congress to have continuity of operations. https://t.co/6w628DcqFv

The #COVID_19 crisis highlights why we need comprehensive paid sick leave is. Nobody should go to work sick—putting other employees and the public at risk—because they won’t otherwise be able to put food on the table.  Read my op-ed with @RepMalinowski ⬇ https://t.co/p5WlYnnVjo

People are concerned about paying their bills and staying safe during this pandemic—they shouldn’t also have to worry about companies profiting off their personal data.  @RepMalinowski and I are conducting oversight of the tech giant behind a new #Covid_19 triage website. https://t.co/OCdiwqA9Vr

We all have a role to play in combating #Covid_19. @amazon has the capacity to save hundreds of thousands of lives by redeploying its vast resources creatively. I’m asking CEO @JeffBezos to redirect its stock of face masks and sanitizer to help hospitals fill shortages. https://t.co/Fjz90i7bKj

I promised to keep #CA45 residents up to date about what’s happening with the coronavirus outbreak. Tomorrow I’m hosting a telephone town hall with UCI Public Health Professor Andrew Noymer to share the latest information and answer questions about COVID-19. More info here ⬇️⬇️ https://t.co/Pfy4XEDhPD

Yesterday @CDCDirector committed to making #Covid_19 diagnostic tests free for everyone who needs them. Now he’s trying to break that promise and I won’t allow it. So today I called on @CDCGov to provide clarity and a recommitment.  More here >> https://t.co/oQ7lfXqJe7

The Administration isn’t acting with the urgency this issue deserves. So I’m leading over 80 of my colleagues in calling on @US_FDA and @HHSGov to issue guidance allowing academic medical centers to support the rest of the medical community in preventing the spread of #Covid_19. https://t.co/2lFE6awV3d

I did the math: a full battery of coronavirus testing costs at minimum $1331.  I also did the legal research: the Administration has the authority to make testing free for every American TODAY.  I secured a commitment from a high-level Trump official that they’d actually do it. https://t.co/RmolCtmNbG
Will stop spread of coronavirus: ✅ washing your hands ✅ staying home if you’re sick  Won’t stop spread of coronavirus: ❌ racism ❌ xenophobia  Delete this tweet @GOPLeader. https://t.co/hd6VX3RuHo

Knowing if you have COVID-19 can help keep you your family and our community safe. We need to be equipped with the best tools and knowledge to fight this coronavirus and the cost of diagnostic testing cannot be a barrier.

I refuse to put patients’ health at risk so that insurance companies can use COVID-19 to pad their profits. Patients with private insurance shouldn’t have to choose between lab tests for this virus and putting food on the table.

The same day Administration officials briefed Congressmembers and told us that everyone who needs to can get tested for the coronavirus we see news like this. So were we lied to or does the Administration not understand the scope of what we’re dealing with? https://t.co/dI7XPeioc0

I also backed $8.3 billion in emergency funding today to combat the spread of the coronavirus which includes: ✅ $1 billion for medical supplies for providers ✅ $3 billion for R&D ✅ $950 million for state agencies and ✅ $300 million to increase vaccine affordability.

Orange County families want results not rhetoric. So this afternoon instead of listening to Vice President Pence talk about the Administration's failed attempts to stop the coronavirus I held a call with OC hospital leaders on the frontlines of this fight. https://t.co/pIePuh4USp
Orange County is declaring a health emergency in response to coronavirus. Read my statement on this ⬇️⬇️ https://t.co/TWf50b2mXv

I promised to keep Orange County residents informed about developments on coronavirus regardless of their primary language. The updated FAQ I released this week is available in both English and Chinese. For those who find it helpful here it is >> https://t.co/3y5IaggVh4

ICYMI: yesterday I released an updated FAQ for those who want to learn more on coronavirus. I'm sticking to my commitment to keep Orange County families informed about what's happening.  https://t.co/WeZcxweL1T

When it comes to dealing with a public health emergency like coronavirus the hasty spread of misinformation hurts response efforts. To set the record straight I had our office prepare an FAQ to share facts with the public. Please read and share widely. https://t.co/yJeYOrVsev

During the district work period I saw firsthand how the threat of coronavirus is hurting our community—for example leading to the cancellation of Lunar New Year celebrations. I'm calling on @CDCgov to brief Members of Congress ASAP on our government's response to this threat. https://t.co/KSYgh0wWRP
